definition: A metacognitive process in which an agent tracks its own internal states, thoughts, and actions against goals or norms.

positive_examples: I was watching my own reasoning slip into confirmation bias and tried to correct it.
The system tracks its own uncertainty and flags when it might be hallucinating.
She noticed her attention drifting and deliberately brought it back to the task.
negative_examples: The sensor recorded the room temperature over time.
He read the article without reflecting on how he felt about it.
The model simply answered the question without commenting on its own performance.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not just any self-reference; specifically the process of monitoring and evaluating one's own cognitive or behavioral state.
